page.title: 17THE COMMUNITY OF HIGHLEADON
page.content: Highleadon straddles the B4216 and lane to Upleadon. It has a small, 'aging' population. Highleadon and Rudford have a joint Parish Council, meeting every 6 weeks. Currently, the Council has a Bill before Parliament to change Common Land into a Village Green at the Highleadon-Hartpury road junction. They are also concerned that the former Methodist Chapel, closed in 1983, becomes a private dwelling and the graveyard is maintained. Community life centres on Rudford Hall built as a 2nd World War memorial. The Women's Institute meets monthly on 3rd Wednesday and regular whist drives provide income for hall funds. The Rudford and Highleadon Table Tennis Club have 6 teams in the Gloucester League and built their own hall alongside the Village Hall in 1984.
